cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 115 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to meander near the coast before drifting slowly northeast toward southwest Louisiana
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: middle Texas coast near Corpus Christi–Port O’Connor

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, MX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield TX to High Island TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX and south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: upper and middle Texas coast and southwest Louisiana coast, including the Lake Charles–Cameron area
weather_observation.wind: Tropical–storm–force winds possible (29 % chance) with peak onset probabilities Monday–Tuesday; gusts could reach 40–50 mph.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the southwest Louisiana coast including Calcasieu Pass and approaches to Lake Charles.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–15 inches of rain forecast for southwest and central Louisiana with locally higher amounts, producing a high risk of flooding in the Lake Charles area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands; dangerous rip currents and elevated waves may affect marine approaches.
